Description: A string of heavy, long barrel, oblate and standard truncated convex bicone beads of amethyst. The beads are large and thick, the borings wide. The colour of the amethyst varies; many of the beads are very pale. In the centre of the string is a long barrel of very pale amethyst containing iron pyrites.
Curator's comments: This is a string of mixed date: some of the beads are probably later than the Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (484)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
